chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick C. Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick C. Kratz

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

11:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick C. Kratz in court, in custody.  Attorney Karen L. Marone in court for Frederick C. Kratz. 
2022CM000020, 2022CM000021, 2022FO000015, 2022TR000072 & 22CF9 tracking together:
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Counts 2 & 3 in 22CF9.  Counts 1, 4, 5 & 6 to be dismissed and read-in.  22CM20 & 22CM21 to be dismissed and read-in.  22FO15 & 22TR72 to be dismissed.
Atty Marone agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 1, 4, 5 & 6 to be dismissed and read-in.  22CM20 & 22CM21 to be dismissed and read-in.  22FO15 & 22TR72 to be dismissed.

Atty Marone waives a PSI request.  Atty Juech waives a PSI request.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Marone makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  22CF9, Counts 2 & 3:  Court orders 3 1/2 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 18 months Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to each other and concurrent to his Columbia County sentence in 12CF16 on each count
Forthwith
Credit = 160 days 
Court Costs = $268.00 x 2
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $250.00 x 2
Conditions of Extended Supervision will be left up to the Agent but to include AODA and any follow-up treatment 
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Counts 1, 4, 5 & 6 to be dismissed and read-in.  
22CM20 & 22CM21 to be dismissed and read-in.  
22FO15 & 22TR72 to be dismissed.

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick C. Kratz appeared by video, in custody from Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Karen L. Marone in court for Frederick C. Kratz. 
2022CM000020, 2022CM000021, 2022FO000015, 2022TR000072 & 22CF9 tracking together:
Atty Marone states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Marone did not receive the information.  Court prints a copy.  Atty Marone received a copy of the information and asks that an arraignment be set.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:30 AM Defendant Frederick C. Kratz in court with attorney Karen L. Marone.  Defendant Frederick C. Kratz in custody.  Clifford C. Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CM21, 22CF9, 22CM20, 22TR72, 22FO15 & 22GF2 tracking together:
Atty Marone would like to continue with the Treatment Court Program but understands the reasons why and does not object to termination.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant will be terminated from the Marquette County Treatment Court Program in 22GF2

Atty Marone asks that a status be set.  Atty Burdon asks that a waiver of Prelim be set.  Atty Marone agrees.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

01:56 PM Defendant Frederick C. Kratz appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Karen L. Marone appeared by phone means for Defendant Frederick C. Kratz.
22CF9, 22CM20, 22CM21, 22FO15, 22TR72
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading in 22CM20 & 22CM21.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Atty Marone enters Not Guilty plea on all charges in 22CM20 & 22CM21.  BY THE COURT:  Court will also enter Not Guilty plea on all traffic cases.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.
Breakout Room held.  All parties back on the record.  Atty Marone requests 4/5/22 status or possible plea.
Set for status.
  Status hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:15 AM Attorney Karen L. Marone appeared by phone means for Defendant Frederick C. Kratz. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Frederick C. Kratz appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
  Atty Marone states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  
Atty Marone states that the defendant waives time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:51 PM Defendant Frederick C. Kratz appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Cliff Burdon appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify and will be appointing private bar within a couple weeks.  
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Burdon requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Victim 1, Victim 2, Witness 1 or Witness 2 or their residences
  Initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
